text.sanskrit: सोमस्य मा तवसं वक्ष्यग्ने वह्निं चकर्थ विदथे यजध्यै ।देवाँ अच्छा दीद्यद्युंजे अद्रिं शमाये अग्ने तन्वं जुषस्व ॥

translations.text: Render me vigorous,Agni, since you have made me the bearer of theSomato offer it in the sacrifice; honouring the gods who are present, I take hold of the stone (to express Soma); I propitiate them; do you, Agni, protect my person n.

text.sanskrit: प्रांचं यज्ञं चकृम वर्धतां गीः समिद्भिरग्निं नमसा दुवस्यन् ।दिवः शशासुर्विदथा कवीनां गृत्साय चित्तवसे गातुमीषुः ॥

translations.text: We have performed,Agni, a successful sacrifice; may my praise magnify (you) as worshipping you with fuel and with reverence; (the gods) fromheaven desire the adoration of the pious, who are anxious to praise the adorable and mighty (Agni).

translations.text: The gods discovered the gracefulAgni(concealed) amidst the waters of the flowing (rivers), for the purpose of (sacred) acts; Agni, who is intelligent,of purified vigour, and friendly; who from his birth bestowed happiness on earth and heaven.

text.sanskrit: चंद्रमग्निं चंद्ररथं हरिव्रतं वैश्वानरमप्सुषदं स्वर्विदं ।विगाहं तूर्णिं तविषीभिरावृतं भूर्णिं देवास इह सुश्रियं दधुः ॥

translations.text: The gods have plural ced in this world the delightfulAgniin a delightful chariot, the tawny-huedVaiśvānara, the sitter in the waters, the omniscient, the all-pervading, the endowed with energies, the cherisher, the illustrious.

text.sanskrit: अग्निर्देवेभिर्मनुषश्च जंतुभिस्तन्वानो यज्ञं पुरुपेशसं धिया ।रथीरंतरीयते साधदिष्टिभिर्जीरो दमूना अभिशस्तिचातनः ॥

translations.text: Perfecting the performance the multiform sacrifice of the worshipper, along with the gods to whom solemnities have been addressed, and together withthe priests,Agni, the charioteer, the swift-moving, the humble-minded, the destroyer of foes, passes along between (heaven and earth).

text.sanskrit: अग्ने जरस्व स्वपत्य आयुन्यूर्जा पिन्वस्व समिषो दिदीहि नः ।वयांसि जिन्व बृहतश्च जागृव उशिग्देवानामसि सुक्रतुर्विपां ॥

translations.text: Agni, praise (the gods that we may enjoy) good offspring and long life; propitiate them by libations; bestow upon us plural ntiful crops; ever vigilant, gran tfood to the respectable (instrumental tutor of this ceremony), for you are the desired of the gods, the object of the pious acts of the devout.

text.sanskrit: विश्पतिं यह्वमतिथिं नरः सदा यंतारं धीनामुशिजं च वाघतां ।अध्वराणां चेतनं जातवेदसं प्र शंसंति नमसा जूतिभिर्वृधे ॥

text.sanskrit: विभावा देवः सुरणः परि क्षितीरग्निर्बभूव शवसा सुमद्रथः ।तस्य व्रतानि भूरिपोषिणो वयमुप भूषेम दम आ सुवृक्तिभिः ॥

translations.text: The resplendent and adorableAgni, riding in an auspicious chariot, has comprehended the whole earth by his vigour; let us glorify with fit praises the acts of that cherisher of multitudes in his own abode.

text.sanskrit: वैश्वानर तव धामान्या चके येभिः स्वर्विदभवो विचक्षण ।जात आपृणो भुवनानि रोदसी अग्ने ता विश्वा परिभूरसि त्मना ॥

translations.text: Vaiśvānara, I celebrate your energies, whereby, O sage, you have become omniscient; as soon as born,Agni, you have occupied the realms (of space), and heaven and earth, and have comprehended all these with yourself.

translations.text: From acts that are acceptable toVaiśvānaracomes great (wealth); for he, the sage (Agni) alone, bestows (the reward) of zeal in (the performance of) his worship; adoring both his prolific friends, heaven and earth, Agni was born.

text.sanskrit: समित्समित्सुमना बोध्यस्मे शुचाशुचा सुमतिं रासि वस्वः ।आ देव देवान्यजथाय वक्षि सखा सखीन्त्सुमना यक्ष्यग्ने ॥

translations.text: Repeatedly, kindled, (Agni), wake up favourably disposed; (endowed) with reiterated lustre, entertain the kind purpose of (granting us) wealth; bring, divine Agni, the gods to the sacrifice; do you, the friend (of the gods), minister, well-affected, to (your) parents.

text.sanskrit: प्र दीधितिर्विश्ववारा जिगाति होतारमिळः प्रथमं यजध्यै ।अच्छा नमोभिर्वृषभं वंदध्यै स देवान्यक्षदिषितो यजीयान् ॥

translations.text: May the all-approved praise reach the invoker of the gods; may Iḷā first proceed to worship and to praise with prostrations the showerer (of benefits) in his presence; may the adorable (Agni), instrumental gated (by us), worship the gods.

text.sanskrit: मित्रो अग्निर्भवति यत्समिद्धो मित्रो होता वरुणो जातवेदाः ।मित्रो अध्वर्युरिषिरो दमूना मित्रः सिंधूनामुत पर्वतानां ॥

translations.text: Agni, when kindled, isMitra; and, as Mitra, is the invoker (of the gods);VaruṇaisJātavedas; Mitra is the ministering priest; Damunas is the agitator (Vāyu); Mitra (is the associate) of rivers and mountains.

translations.text: The graceful (Agni) protects the primary station of the moving earth; mighty, he protects the path of the sun; he protects the seven-headed (troop of theMaruts) in the centre between heaven and earth; he protects the exhilarating (oblations) of the gods.

text.sanskrit: दिवक्षसो धेनवो वृष्णो अश्वा देवीरा तस्थौ मधुमद्वहंतीः ।ऋतस्य त्वा सदसि क्षेमयंतं पर्येका चरति वर्तनिं गौः ॥

translations.text: The sky-traversing steeds of the showerer (of benefits) are the kine (ofAgni); as he attains the divine (rivers), bearers of sweet (water). One sacred soudn glorifies you (Agni), who are desirous of repose, pacifying your flames) in the abode of the water (the firmament).
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: आ सीमरोहत्सुयमा भवंतीः पतिश्चिकित्वान्रयिविद्रयीणां ।प्र नीलपृष्ठो अतसस्य धासेस्ता अवासयत्पुरुधप्रतीकः ॥
text.iast: ā  sīm  arohat  su-yamāḥ  bhavantīḥ  patiḥ  cikitvān  rayi-vít  rayīṇām pra  nīla-pṛṣṭhaḥ  atasasya  dhāseḥ  tāḥ  avāsayat  purudha-pratīkaḥ ||

translations.text: Their lord has mounted on his well-trained mares the sagacious selector of treasures, the blackbacked, many-limbed (Agni) has granted them a plural ce of rest for the cherishing of (their) rapid speed.

text.sanskrit: महि त्वाष्ट्रमूर्जयंतीरजुर्यं स्तभूयमानं वहतो वहंति ।व्यंगेभिर्दिद्युतानः सधस्थ एकामिव रोदसी आ विवेश ॥
text.iast: mahi  tvāṣṭram  ūrjayantīḥ  ajuryam  stabhu-yamānam  vahataḥ  vahanti ví  aṅgebhiḥ  didyutānaḥ  sadha-sthe  ekām-iva  rodasī íti  ā  viveśa ||

translations.text: The flowing (rivers) invigorating him, bear along the great son ofTvaṣṭā, the undecaying upholder (of the world), radiant with various forms in the vicinity (of the firmament);Agniis associated with heaven and earth, as (a husband with) one only wife.

text.iast: jānanti  vṛṣṇaḥ  aruṣasya  śevam  uta  bradhnasya  śāsane  raṇanti divaḥ-rucaḥ  su-rucaḥ  rocamānāḥ  íḷā  yeṣām  gaṇyā  māhinā  gīḥ ||

translations.text: Men comprehend the service of the uninjurable showerer (of benefits), and exult in the commands of the mighty (Agni); their frequent and earnest hymns of praise, bright and radiant, are illuminating heaven.

translations.text: Verily (men) bring great delight toAgniby glorifying aloud the mighty parents (heaven and earth), when the shedder of rain approximates his own radiance to the worshipper, (wherewith) to invest the night.

text.sanskrit: अध्वर्युभिः पंचभिः सप्त विप्राः प्रियं रक्षंते निहितं पदं वेः ।प्रांचो मदंत्युक्षणो अजुर्या देवा देवानामनु हि व्रता गुः ॥
text.iast: adhvaryu-bhiḥ  pañca-bhiḥ  sapta  víprāḥ  priyam  rakṣante  ní-hitam  padam  veríti veḥ prāñcaḥ  madanti  ukṣaṇaḥ  ajuryāḥ  devāḥ  devānām  anu  hí  vratā  guríti guḥ ||

translations.text: Seven sages with five ministering priests attend the station that is prepared for the rapid (Agni); the undecaying divine (sages), with their faces to the east, sprinkling (the libations), rejoice as they celebrate the worship of the gods.

translations.text: I propitiate the two first divine offerers of sacrifices; the seven (priests) rejoice with the libation; the illustrious celebrators of holy worship, reciting (his) praises, have calledAgnithe true (object) of every rite.

text.sanskrit: वृषायंते महे अत्याय पूर्वीर्वृष्णे चित्राय रश्मयः सुयामाः ।देव होतर्मंद्रतरश्चिकित्वान्महो देवान्रोदसी एह वक्षि ॥
text.iast: vṛṣa-yante  mahe  atyāya  pūrvīḥ  vṛṣṇe  citrāya  raśmayaḥ  su-yāmāḥ deva  hotaḥ  mandra-taraḥ  cikitvān  mahaḥ  devān  rodasī íti  ā  iha  vakṣi ||

translations.text: Divine invoker of the gods, the vast and widespreading rays shed (moisture) for you, the mighty, the victorius, the wonderful, the showerer (of benefits); do you who are all knowing, joy-bestowing, bring hither the great gods, and heaven and earth.

text.sanskrit: पृक्षप्रयजो द्रविणः सुवाचः सुकेतव उषसो रेवदूषुः ।उतो चिदग्ने महिना पृथिव्याः कृतं चिदेनः सं महे दशस्य ॥
text.iast: pṛkṣa-prayajaḥ  draviṇaḥ  su-vācaḥ  su-ketavaḥ  uṣasaḥ  revat  ūṣuḥ uto íti  cit  agne  mahinā  pṛthivyāḥ  kṛtam  cit  enaḥ  sam  mahe  daśasya ||

translations.text: Ever-moving (Agni) may the mornings rise for us, abounding with oblations, with pious prayers, and with auspicious signs, and conferring wealth; and do you with the might of your (diffusive flame), consume all sin on behalf of your respectable (worshipper).

text.iast: íḷām  agne  puru-daṃsam  saním  goḥ  śaśvat-tamam  havamānāya  sādha syāt  naḥ  sūnuḥ  tanayaḥ  vijā-vā  agne  sā  te  su-matíḥ  bhūtu  asme íti ||

translations.text: Grant,Agni, to the offerer of the oblation, the earth, the bestower of cattle, the means of many (pious rites), such that it may be perpetual; may there be to us sons and grandsons, and may your good-will ever be upon us (productive of benefit to us).

translations.text: Desirous as you are of the forests since you have repaired to the maternal waters,Agni, your tarrying so far away is not to be endured; (in a moment) you are here with us.

translations.text: Agni, who is irresistible and the showerer (of benefits), consume victorious all the cities (of the foe) and (all their) precious things; do you, the duly worshipped, the knower of all that is born, (be for us) the conductor of the first great preserving sacrifice.

text.sanskrit: स तेजीयसा मनसा त्वोत उत शिक्ष स्वपत्यस्य शिक्षोः ।अग्ने रायो नृतमस्य प्रभूतौ भूयाम ते सुष्टुतयश्च वस्वः ॥

translations.text: He who isprotected,Agni, by you, becomes endowed with a most luminous mind; bestow upon him excellent progeny; may we ever be under the power of you who is the willing dispenser of riches; glorifying you (may we be) the receptacles of wealth.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: भूरीणि हि त्वे दधिरे अनीकाग्ने देवस्य यज्यवो जनासः ।स आ वह देवतातिं यविष्ठ शर्धो यदद्य दिव्यं यजासि ॥

translations.text: The ministering priests have concentrated in youAgni, who are divine, many hosts (of flames); do you bring hither the gods, youngest (of the deities), that you may worship today the divine effulgence.

text.sanskrit: यत्त्वा होतारमनजन्मियेधे निषादयंतो यजथाय देवाः ।स त्वं नो अग्नेऽवितेह बोध्यधि श्रवांसि धेहि नस्तनूषु ॥

translations.text: Inasmuch as the attendant divine (priests) anoint you as the invoker of the gods to offer worship in the sacrifice, therefore do you assent to be our protector on this occasion, and grant abundant food to our descendants.

text.sanskrit: अग्निमुषसमश्विना दधिक्रां व्युष्टिषु हवते वह्निरुक्थैः ।सुज्योतिषो नः शृण्वंतु देवाः सजोषसो अध्वरं वावशानाः ॥

translations.text: The bearer (of the oblation) invokes with praises at the break of day,Agni, the dawn, theAśvins, and Dadhikra); may the resplendent divinities, desirous of our sacrifice, hear in unison (the invocation).

text.sanskrit: अग्ने त्री ते वाजिना त्री षधस्था तिस्रस्ते जिह्वा ऋतजात पूर्वीः ।तिस्र उ ते तन्वो देववातास्ताभिर्नः पाहि गिरो अप्रयुच्छन् ॥

translations.text: Agni, born of sacrifice, three are your viands; three your abiding plural ces, three the tongue satisfying (thegods); three verily are your forms acceptable to the deities, and with them never heedless (of our wishes), bepropitious to our praises.

translations.text: DivineAgni, knowing all that exists and distributor of food, many are the names of you who are immortal satisffier of all men, friend of the suppliant, the gods have deposited in you whatever are the delusions of the deluding (rākṣasas).

translations.text: The divineAgniis the guide of devout men, as the sun is the regulator of the seasons; may he, the observer of truth, the slayer ofVṛtra, the ancient, the omniscient convey his adorer (safe) over all difficulties.

text.iast: tanū-napāt  ucyate  garbhaḥ  āsuraḥ  narāśaṃsaḥ  bhavati  yat  vi-jāyate mātaríśvā  yat  amimīta  mātari  vātasya  sargaḥ  abhavat  sarīmaṇi ||

translations.text: When (existing) as an embryo (in the wood),Agniis called Tanunapāt; when he is genitive rated (he is called) theasura-destroying narāśam,sa; when he has displayed (his energy) in the material firmament,Mātariśvan; and the creation of the wind is in his rapid motion.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: सुनिर्मथा निर्मथितः सुनिधा निहितः कविः ।अग्ने स्वध्वरा कृणु देवांदेवयते यज ॥
text.iast: suniḥ-mathā  níḥ-mathitaḥ  su-nidhā  ní-hitaḥ  kavíḥ agne  su-adhvarā  kṛṇu  devān  deva-yate  yaja ||

translations.text: Agni, who is pronounced by reverential attrition, and deposited with reverential care, and who are far-seeing, render our rites (exempt from defects), and worship the gods (on behalf) of the devout worshipper.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: अजीजनन्नमृतं मर्त्यासोऽस्रेमाणं तरणिं वीळुजंभं ।दश स्वसारो अग्रुवः समीचीः पुमांसं जातमभि सं रभंते ॥
text.iast: ajījanan  amṛtam  martyāsaḥ  asremāṇam  taraṇim  vīḷu-jambham daśa  svasāraḥ  agruvaḥ  sam-īcīḥ  pumāṃsam  jātam  abhí  sam  rabhante ||

translations.text: Mortals have begotten the immortals, the undecaying (Agni), the devourer of oblations, the conveyance (by which they cross over sin), the ten sister fingers intertwined proclaim him born as if it was amale(infant).

text.sanskrit: प्र सप्तहोता सनकादरोचत मातुरुपस्थे यदशोचदूधनि ।न नि मिषति सुरणो दिवेदिवे यदसुरस्य जठरादजायत ॥
text.iast: pra  sapta-hotā  sanakāt  arocata  mātuḥ  upa-sthe  yat  aśocat  ūdhani na  ní  miṣati  su-raṇaḥ  dive-dive  yat  asurasya  jaṭharāt  ajāyata ||

translations.text: Agni, who has seven ministering priests, shines eternally; when he has blazed upon the bosom and lap of his mother (earth), he is vociferous (with delight); day by day he never slumbers after he is born from the interior of the (spark) emitting wood.

text.sanskrit: अमित्रायुधो मरुतामिव प्रयाः प्रथमजा ब्रह्मणो विश्वमिद्विदुः ।द्युम्नवद्ब्रह्म कुशिकास एरिर एकएको दमे अग्निं समीधिरे ॥
text.iast: amitra-yudhaḥ  marutām-iva  pra-yāḥ  prathama-jāḥ  brahmaṇaḥ  víśvam  ít  viduḥ dyumna-vat  brahma  kuśikāsaḥ  ā  īrire  ekaḥ-ekaḥ  dame  agnim  sam  īdhire ||

translations.text: TheKuśikas, the first-born ofBrahmā, armed against enemies like the energies of theMaruts, comprehend the universe; they have uttered the prayer accompanied by the oblation; they have one by one lightedAgniin this dwelling.

text.sanskrit: यदद्य त्वा प्रयति यज्ञे अस्मिन्होतश्चिकित्वोऽवृणीमहीह ।ध्रुवमया ध्रुवमुताशमिष्ठाः प्रजानन्विद्वाँ उप याहि सोमं ॥
text.iast: yat  adya  tvā  pra-yatí  yajñe  asmín  hotaríti  cikitvaḥ  avṛṇīmahi  iha dhruvam  ayāḥ  dhruvam  uta  aśamiṣṭhāḥ  pra-jānan  vidvān  upa  yāhi  somam ||

translations.text: Agni, offerer of oblations, cognizant of rites, inasmuch as we have recourse to you today in this progressing sacrifice, therefore do you steadily convey (the offering to the gods), or tranquilly be at rest, and knowing (the purport of our acts), and wise (in all respects), approach (and accept) theSoma.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: इच्छंति त्वा सोम्यासः सखायः सुन्वंति सोमं दधति प्रयांसि ।तितिक्षंते अभिशस्तिं जनानामिंद्र त्वदा कश्चन हि प्रकेतः ॥
text.iast: icchanti  tvā  somyāsaḥ  sakhāyaḥ  sunvanti  somam  dadhati  prayāṃsi títikṣante  abhí-śastim  janānām  índra  tvat  ā  kaḥ  cana  hí  pra-ketaḥ ||

translations.text: The bearers of the libations desire you; your friends pour forth theSoma; they offer copious oblations; (supported by) you they endure patiently the calumny of men, for who is so renowned as you are.

text.sanskrit: न ते दूरे परमा चिद्रजांस्या तु प्र याहि हरिवो हरिभ्यां ।स्थिराय वृष्णे सवना कृतेमा युक्ता ग्रावाणः समिधाने अग्नौ ॥
text.iast: na  te  dūre  paramā  cit  rajāṃsi  ā  tu  pra  yāhi  hari-vaḥ  hari-bhyām sthirāya  vṛṣṇe  savanā  kṛtā  imā  yuktāḥ  grāvāṇaḥ  sam-idhāne  agnau ||

translations.text: Master of tawny steeds, the remotest regions are not remote for you; then come quickly with your horses; to you the steady showerer (of benefits), these sacrifices are presented; the stones (for bruising theSoma) are ready, as the fire is being kindled.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: इंद्रः सुशिप्रो मघवा तरुत्रो महाव्रातस्तुविकूर्मिर्ऋघावान् ।यदुग्रो धा बाधितो मर्त्येषु क्व त्या ते वृषभ वीर्याणि ॥
text.iast: índraḥ  su-śípraḥ  magha-vā  tarutraḥ  mahā-vrātaḥ  tuvi-kūrmíḥ  ṛghāvān yat  ugraḥ  dhāḥ  bādhitaḥ  martyeṣu  kva  tyā  te  vṛṣabha  vīryāṇi ||

translations.text: Showerer (of benefits), who areIndra, the wearer of the helmet, the professor of opulence, the conveyor (of men beyond the evil), the leader of the numerous troops (of theMaruts), the achiever of many great deeds, the devastation of hostile (regions), the terror of your foes, where are those heroic deeds (which you have performed) against the mortal (asuras) when opposed (by them in battle).

text.sanskrit: त्वं हि ष्मा च्यावयन्नच्युतान्येको वृत्रा चरसि जिघ्नमानः ।तव द्यावापृथिवी पर्वतासोऽनु व्रताय निमितेव तस्थुः ॥

translations.text: You alone casting down the firmly-footed (asuras) proceed, destroying theVṛtras, and obedient to your command the heaven and earth and the mountains stood as if immoveable.

text.sanskrit: उताभये पुरुहूत श्रवोभिरेको दृळ्हमवदो वृत्रहा सन् ।इमे चिदिंद्र रोदसी अपारे यत्संगृभ्णा मघवन्काशिरित्ते ॥
text.iast: uta  abhaye  puru-hūta  śravaḥ-bhiḥ  ekaḥ  dṛḷham  avadaḥ  vṛtra-hā  san ime  cit  indra  rodasī íti  apāre íti  yat  sam-gṛbhṇāḥ  magha-van  kāśíḥ  ít  te ||

translations.text: You alone, when invoked by many, and the slayer ofVṛtra, by your prowess, did say firmly (to the gods), fear not!Indra, endowed with opulence, vast is your grasp, wherewith you have seized these unbounded regions, heaven and earth.

text.sanskrit: प्र सू त इंद्र प्रवता हरिभ्यां प्र ते वज्रः प्रमृणन्नेतु शत्रून् ।जहि प्रतीचो अनूचः पराचो विश्वं सत्यं कृणुहि विष्टमस्तु ॥
text.iast: pra  su  te  indra  pra-vatā  hari-bhyām  pra  te  vajraḥ  pra-mṛṇan  etu  śatrūn jahí  pratīcaḥ  anūcaḥ  parācaḥ  víśvam  satyam  kṛṇuhi  viṣṭam  astu ||

translations.text: Let (your car),Indra, drawn by your horses (rush) downwards (upon theasuras); let your destroying thunder-bolt fall upon your enemies; slay those that assail in front or in rear, or that fly (from the combat); make the universe (the abode of) truth; (let such power) be concentrated in you.

text.sanskrit: यस्मै धायुरदधा मर्त्यायाभक्तं चिद्भजते गेह्यं सः ।भद्रा त इंद्र सुमतिर्घृताची सहस्रदाना पुरुहूत रातिः ॥

translations.text: The man to whom you grant, lord of power, (your good-will), enjoys unprecedented domestic (prosperity);Indra, who are invoked by many, your auspicous favour, which is obtained by oblations, is the giver of unbounded wealth.

text.sanskrit: सहदानुं पुरुहूत क्षियंतमहस्तमिंद्र सं पिणक्कुणारुं ।अभि वृत्रं वर्धमानं पियारुमपादमिंद्र तवसा जघंथ ॥
text.iast: saha-dānum  puru-hūta  kṣiyantam  ahastam  indra  sam  piṇak  kuṇārum abhí  vṛtram  vardhamānam  píyārum  apādam  indra  tavasā  jaghantha ||

translations.text: Indra, who is invoked by many, grind to dust the reviling malevolentVṛtraopposing you, dwelling with the mother of theDānavas, and increasing in might, until having deprived him ofhandand foot, you have destroyed him by your strength.

text.sanskrit: नि सामनामिषिरामिंद्र भूमिं महीमपारां सदने ससत्थ ।अस्तभ्नाद्द्यां वृषभो अंतरिक्षमर्षंत्वापस्त्वयेह प्रसूताः ॥

translations.text: You have fixed tranquil in its position the vast unbounded and wandering earth; the showerer (of benefits) has upheld the heaven and the firmament; let the waters engendered by you here descend.

text.sanskrit: अलातृणो वल इंद्र व्रजो गोः पुरा हंतोर्भयमानो व्यार ।सुगान्पथो अकृणोन्निरजे गाः प्रावन्वाणीः पुरुहूतं धमंतीः ॥
text.iast: alātṛṇaḥ  valaḥ  indra  vrajaḥ  goḥ  purā  hantoḥ  bhayamānaḥ  ví  āra su-gān  pathaḥ  akṛṇot  niḥ-aje  gāḥ  pra  āvan  vāṇīḥ  puru-hūtam  dhamantīḥ ||

translations.text: The heavy cloud, the receptacle of water, dreading you its destroyer, opened out before (you had cast your bolt); thenIndramade easily-traversed paths for the waters to issue, and desirable and loud sounding they proceeded to the (waters of the earth) invoked of many.

text.sanskrit: एको द्वे वसुमती समीची इंद्र आ पप्रौ पृथिवीमुत द्यां ।उतांतरिक्षादभि नः समीक इषो रथीः सयुजः शूर वाजान् ॥

text.sanskrit: दिशः सूर्यो न मिनाति प्रदिष्टा दिवेदिवे हर्यश्वप्रसूताः ।सं यदानळध्वन आदिदश्वैर्विमोचनं कृणुते तत्त्वस्य ॥

text.sanskrit: दिदृक्षंत उषसो यामन्नक्तोर्विवस्वत्या महि चित्रमनीकं ।विश्वे जानंति महिना यदागादिंद्रस्य कर्म सुकृता पुरूणि ॥

text.sanskrit: सं घोषः शृण्वेऽवमैरमित्रैर्जही न्येष्वशनिं तपिष्ठां ।वृश्चेमधस्ताद्वि रुजा सहस्व जहि रक्षो मघवन्रंधयस्व ॥

text.sanskrit: स्वस्तये वाजिभिश्च प्रणेतः सं यन्महीरिष आसत्सि पूर्वीः ।रायो वंतारो बृहतः स्यामास्मे अस्तु भग इंद्र प्रजावान् ॥

translations.text: Bring to us,Indra, splendid affluence; we rely on the bounty of you who are fond of giving; our desire is as insatiable as the fire of the ocean; appease it, lord of infinite riches.

text.sanskrit: न जामये तान्वो रिक्थमारैक्चकार गर्भं सनितुर्निधानं ।यदी मातरो जनयंत वह्निमन्यः कर्ता सुकृतोरन्य ऋंधन् ॥

translations.text: (A son) born of the body, does not transfer (paternal) wealth to a sister; he has made (her) the recptacle of the embryo of the husband; if the parents procreate children (of either sex), one is the performer of holy acts, the other is to be enriched (with gifts).

text.sanskrit: महि क्षेत्रं पुरु श्चंद्रं विविद्वानादित्सखिभ्यश्चरथं समैरत् ।इंद्रो नृभिरजनद्दीद्यानः साकं सूर्यमुषसं गातुमग्निं ॥

translations.text: Wide fields, vast treasure, (spacious) pastures has the much-knowing (Indra) bestowed upon his friends; the radiant Indra with the leaders (of rites, theMaruts) genitive rated the sun, the dawn, the earth and fire.

text.sanskrit: अपश्चिदेष विभ्वो दमूनाः प्र सध्रीचीरसृजद्विश्वश्चंद्राः ।मध्वः पुनानाः कविभिः पवित्रैर्द्युभिर्हिन्वंत्यक्तुभिर्धनुत्रीः ॥

translations.text: This lowly-mindedIndrahas created the wide-spread, commingled, all-delighting waters; and they, purifying the sweet (libations) with the sage purifiers, and being benevolent (to all), proceed with (the revolutions) of days and nights.

text.sanskrit: अनु कृष्णे वसुधिती जिहाते उभे सूर्यस्य मंहना यजत्रे ।परि यत्ते महिमानं वृजध्यै सखाय इंद्र काम्या ऋजिप्याः ॥

translations.text: The two adorable (alternations of) day and night, upholding (all things) by the might of the sun, successively revolve; your sincere and acceptable friends (theMaruts) are ready to encounter (your foes) and maintain your greatness.

text.sanskrit: पतिर्भव वृत्रहन्त्सूनृतानां गिरां विश्वायुर्वृषभो वयोधाः ।आ नो गहि सख्येभिः शिवेभिर्महान्महीभिरूतिभिः सरण्यन् ॥

translations.text: Slayer ofVṛtra, do you, who is long lived the showerer (of benefits), the giver of food, be the lord of our true praises, repairing (to the sacrifice), come to us great, with great, friendly, and auspicious protections.

text.sanskrit: तमंगिरस्वन्नमसा सपर्यन्नव्यं कृणोमि सन्यसे पुराजां ।द्रुहो वि याहि बहुला अदेवीः स्वश्च नो मघवन्त्सातये धाः ॥

translations.text: Worshipping him with reverence, like anaṅgiras, I make the ancient (Indra) renovate to accept the oblation; destroy the many impious oppressors (of your worshippers) and bestow upon us,Maghavan, yours own (wealth) for our acceptance.

text.sanskrit: मिहः पावकाः प्रतता अभूवन्त्स्वस्ति नः पिपृहि पारमासां ।इंद्र त्वं रथिरः पाहि नो रिषो मक्षूमक्षू कृणुहि गोजितो नः ॥

text.sanskrit: अदेदिष्ट वृत्रहा गोपतिर्गा अंतः कृष्णाँ अरुषैर्धामभिर्गात् ।प्र सूनृता दिशमान ऋतेन दुरश्च विश्वा अवृणोदप स्वाः ॥

text.sanskrit: शुनं हुवेम मघवानमिंद्रमस्मिन्भरे नृतमं वाजसातौ ।शृण्वंतमुग्रमूतये समत्सु घ्नंतं वृत्राणि संजितं धनानां ॥

translations.text: We invoke for our protection the opulentIndra, distinguished in this combat, the leader in the food-bestowing (strife), hearing (our praise), terriblein battles, the destroyer of foes, the conqueror of wealth.

text.sanskrit: इंद्र सोमं सोमपते पिबेमं माध्यंदिनं सवनं चारु यत्ते ।प्रप्रुथ्या शिप्रे मघवन्नृजीषिन्विमुच्या हरी इह मादयस्व ॥

translations.text: Indra, lord of theSoma, drink this Soma which is grateful to you at noon-day sacrifice,Maghavan, partake of the spiritless Soma, unyoke your horses, and filling their jaws (with fodder), exhilarate them at this ceremony.

text.sanskrit: गवाशिरं मंथिनमिंद्र शुक्रं पिबा सोमं ररिमा ते मदाय ।ब्रह्मकृता मारुतेना गणेन सजोषा रुद्रैस्तृपदा वृषस्व ॥

translations.text: Indra, drink theSomamixed with milk, with butter-milk, or fresh; we offer it for your exhilaration, associated with the devout company of theMarutsand theRudras; drink it till you are satisfied.

text.sanskrit: मनुष्वदिंद्र सवनं जुषाणः पिबा सोमं शश्वते वीर्याय ।स आ ववृत्स्व हर्यश्व यज्ञैः सरण्युभिरपो अर्णा सिसर्षि ॥

translations.text: Phased with the sacrifice, as if it was that ofManu, drink,Indra, theSoma, for the sake of perpetual vigour; come, lord of the tawny steeds, with the adorableMaruts, and with the traversers (of the air); send down the waters (of the firmament) to (blend with) the waters of the earth.

text.sanskrit: अद्रोघ सत्यं तव तन्महित्वं सद्यो यज्जातो अपिबो ह सोमं ।न द्याव इंद्र तवसस्त ओजो नाहा न मासाः शरदो वरंत ॥

text.sanskrit: विवेष यन्मा धिषणा जजान स्तवै पुरा पार्यादिंद्रमह्नः ।अंहसो यत्र पीपरद्यथा नो नावेव यांतमुभये हवंते ॥

translations.text: When the thought of glorifyingIndraentered my mind, then I gave birth (to his praises); may I laud him before encountering distant (evil) days, whereby he may guide us beyond sin; for those on both sides of us invoke him, as (those on either bank of a river hail) a passenger in a boat.

text.sanskrit: आपूर्णो अस्य कलशः स्वाहा सेक्तेव कोशं सिसिचे पिबध्यै ।समु प्रिया आववृत्रन्मदाय प्रदक्षिणिदभि सोमास इंद्रं ॥

translations.text: The vase is filled for him (withSoma); welcomeIndra; I pour it out for you to drink, as a water-carrier (pours water) from his bag; may the grateful Soma flow in reverence round Indra for his exhilaration.

text.sanskrit: न त्वा गभीरः पुरुहूत सिंधुर्नाद्रयः परि षंतो वरंत ।इत्था सखिभ्य इषितो यदिंद्रा दृळ्हं चिदरुजो गव्यमूर्वं ॥

translations.text: Invoked of many, the deep ocean arrests you not, nor do the accompanying mountains (stay you); and therefore, summoned by your friends, you have repressed the strong flame abiding in the abyss.

text.sanskrit: प्र पर्वतानामुशती उपस्थादश्वे इव विषिते हासमाने ।गावेव शुभ्रे मातरा रिहाणे विपाट्छुतुद्री पयसा जवेते ॥

translations.text: Impelled byIndra, soliciting (his commands), you go to the ocean like charioteers (to their goal); flowing together, and swelling with (your) waves, bright (rivers) one of you proceeds to the other.

text.sanskrit: अच्छा सिंधुं मातृतमामयासं विपाशमुर्वीं सुभगामगन्म ।वत्समिव मातरा संरिहाणे समानं योनिमनु संचरंती ॥

translations.text: I repaired to the most material river; I went to the wide auspicious Vipās', flowing together to a common receptacle, like parent cows (hastening to) caress the calf.

text.sanskrit: एना वयं पयसा पिन्वमाना अनु योनिं देवकृतं चरंतीः ।न वर्तवे प्रसवः सर्गतक्तः किंयुर्विप्रो नद्यो जोहवीति ॥
text.iast: enā  vayam  payasā  pínvamānāḥ  anu  yonim  deva-kṛtam  carantīḥ na  vartave  pra-savaḥ  sarga-taktaḥ  kim-yuḥ  vípraḥ  nadyaḥ  johavīti ||

translations.text: The rivers speak: Fertilizing (the land) with this (our) current, we are flowing to the receptacle which has been appointed by the deity (Indra); the course appointed for our going (permits) not of delay; of what is the sage desirious, that he addresses the rivers?

text.sanskrit: रमध्वं मे वचसे सोम्याय ऋतावरीरुप मुहूर्तमेवैः ।प्र सिंधुमच्छा बृहती मनीषावस्युरह्वे कुशिकस्य सूनुः ॥

translations.text: Viśvāmitraspeaks: Rivers, charged with water, rest a moment from your course at my request, who go to gather theSoma; I, the son ofKuśika, desirous of protection, address with earnest prayer especially the river before me.

translations.text: Viśvāmitraspeaks: Ever is that heroic exploit ofIndrato be celebrated when he cut Ahi to pieces, and with his thunderbolt destroyed the surrounding (obstructors of the rain), whence the waters proceed in the direction they desire.

text.sanskrit: ओ षु स्वसारः कारवे शृणोत ययौ वो दूरादनसा रथेन ।नि षू नमध्वं भवता सुपारा अधोअक्षाः सिंधवः स्रोत्याभिः ॥
text.iast: o íti  su  svasāraḥ  kārave  śṛṇota  yayau  vaḥ  dūrāt  anasā  rathena ní  su  namadhvam  bhavata  su-pārāḥ  adhaḥ-akṣāḥ  sindhavaḥ  srotyābhiḥ ||

translations.text: Viśvāmitraspeaks: Listen, sister (streams), kindly to him who praises you; who has come from afar with a waggon and chariot; bow down lowly; become easily fordable; remain, rivers, lower than the axle (of the wheel) with your currents.

translations.text: Lord of the virtuous, fulfiller of the wishes of men, he gave to the gods the wealth (that had been won) in fierce battle, and therefore far-seeing sages glorify those his exploits with praises in the dwelling of the worshipper.

translations.text: Devout worshippers propitiateIndra, the victorious, the excellent, the bestower of strength, the enjoyer of heaven and the divine waters, and who was the giver of the earth and heaven and this (firmament to their inhabitants).

text.sanskrit: तिष्ठा हरी रथ आ युज्यमाना याहि वायुर्न नियुतो नो अच्छ ।पिबास्यंधो अभिसृष्टो अस्मे इंद्र स्वाहा ररिमा ते मदाय ॥

translations.text: Those who, for (the sake of) the showerer (of benefits), milk the agreeable (produce) of the cow, (who is known) by (many) names, they invested with the diversified strength (of theasuras) and practising delusive art have deposited their own nature in him.

translations.text: You two secure the great felicity of the ancient (worshipper), that which is happiness in heaven; do you (therefore) be even about us; all those who exercise illusion, contemplate the manifold expoits of the everlasting and blandly-speakingIndra.

text.sanskrit: इंद्रो हर्यंतमर्जुनं वज्रं शुक्रैरभीवृतं ।अपावृणोद्धरिभिरद्रिभिः सुतमुद्गा हरिभिराजत ॥
text.iast: índraḥ  haryantam  arjunam  vajram  śukraiḥ  abhí-vṛtam apa  avṛṇot  hari-bhiḥ  adri-bhiḥ  sutam  ut  gāḥ  hari-bhiḥ  ājata ||

translations.text: Indrahas uncovered the desirable white-coloured, fast-flowingSoma, effused by the expressing stones, and overlaid with the shining (milk and other liquids), in like manner as when, borne by his tawny steeds, he rescued the cattle.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: आ मंद्रैरिंद्र हरिभिर्याहि मयूररोमभिः ।मा त्वा के चिन्नि यमन्विं न पाशिनोऽति धन्वेव ताँ इहि ॥
text.iast: ā  mandraiḥ  indra  hari-bhiḥ  yāhí  mayūraroma-bhiḥ mā  tvā  ke  cit  ní  yaman  vím  na  pāśínaḥ  ati  dhanva-iva  tān  ihi ||

translations.text: Come,Indra, with your exulting peacock-haired steeds; let no person ns detain you, as (fowlers) throwing snares catch a bird;pass them by (quickly) as (travellers cross) a desert.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: वृत्रखादो वलंरुजः पुरां दर्मो अपामजः ।स्थाता रथस्य हर्योरभिस्वर इंद्रो दृळ्हा चिदारुजः ॥
text.iast: vṛtra-khādaḥ  valam-rujaḥ  purām  darmaḥ  apām  ajaḥ sthātā  rathasya  haryoḥ  abhi-svare  índraḥ  dṛḷhā  cit  ā-rujaḥ ||

translations.text: The evourer ofVṛtra, the fracturer of the cloud, the sender of the waters, the demolisher of cities,Indra, the destroyer of powerful enemies, has mounted his chariot to urge his horses to our presence.

text.sanskrit: गंभीराँ उदधीँरिव क्रतुं पुष्यसि गा इव ।प्र सुगोपा यवसं धेनवो यथा ह्रदं कुल्या इवाशत ॥
text.iast: gambhīrān  udadhīn-iva  kratum  puṣyasi  gāḥ-iva pra  su-gopāḥ  yavasam  dhenavaḥ  yathā  hradam  kulyāḥ-iva  āśata ||

translations.text: You cherish the celebrator of the pious rite as you fill the deep seas (with water); or as a careful herdsman (cherishes) the cows; (you imbibe theSoma) as cows (obtain) fodder, (and the Soma juices) flow into you as rivulets flow into a lake.

text.sanskrit: आ नस्तुजं रयिं भरांशं न प्रतिजानते ।वृक्षं पक्वं फलमंकीव धूनुहींद्र संपारणं वसु ॥
text.iast: ā  naḥ  tujam  rayím  bhara  aṃśam  na  prati-jānate vṛkṣam  pakvam  phalam  aṅkī-iva  dhūnuhi  índra  sam-pāraṇam  vasu ||

translations.text: Grant us riches, securing (us against foes), (as a father bestows) his portion on (a son) arrived at maturity; send down upon us,Indra, wealth adequate (to our desires), as a crookbringd down the ripe fruit from a tree.

text.sanskrit: स्वयुरिंद्र स्वराळसि स्मद्दिष्टिः स्वयशस्तरः ।स वावृधान ओजसा पुरुष्टुत भवा नः सुश्रवस्तमः ॥
text.iast: sva-yuḥ  indra  sva-rāṭ  asi  smat-diṣṭiḥ  svayaśaḥ-taraḥ saḥ  vavṛdhānaḥ  ojasā  puru-stuta  bhava  naḥ  suśravaḥ-tamaḥ ||

translations.text: You are possessed of opulence,Indra; you are the lord of heaven, auspicious and renowned; may you who is adored of many, increasing in vigour, be to us a most (bountiful bestower) of food.

text.sanskrit: युध्मस्य ते वृषभस्य स्वराज उग्रस्य यूनः स्थविरस्य घृष्वेः ।अजूर्यतो वज्रिणो वीर्याणींद्र श्रुतस्य महतो महानि ॥

translations.text: Vast are the energies of you,Indra, the warrior, (the showerer of benefits), the lord of wealth, the fierce; who is (both) young and old; the overcomer of foes, the undecaying, the wielder of the thunderbolt, and who is mighty and renowned.

text.sanskrit: महाँ असि महिष वृष्ण्येभिर्धनस्पृदुग्र सहमानो अन्यान् ।एको विश्वस्य भुवनस्य राजा स योधया च क्षयया च जनान् ॥
text.iast: mahān  asi  mahiṣa  vṛṣṇyebhiḥ  dhana-spṛt  ugra  sahamānaḥ  anyān ekaḥ  víśvasya  bhuvanasya  rājā  saḥ  yodhayā  ca  kṣayaya  ca  janān ||

translations.text: Adorable and powerfulIndra, you are great and magnificent, overcoming adversaries by your prowess; you alone are lord of all the world; do you war (upon our enemies), and give safe dwellings to men.

text.sanskrit: प्र मात्राभी रिरिचे रोचमानः प्र देवेभिर्विश्वतो अप्रतीतः ।प्र मज्मना दिव इंद्रः पृथिव्याः प्रोरोर्महो अंतरिक्षादृजीषी ॥
text.iast: pra  mātrābhiḥ  ririce  rocamānaḥ  pra  devebhiḥ  viśvataḥ  aprati-itaḥ pra  majmanā  divaḥ  índraḥ  pṛthivyāḥ  pra  uroḥ  mahaḥ  antarikṣāt  ṛjīṣī ||

translations.text: The resplendent and every way unlimitedIndra, drinking the spiritlessSoma, far surpasses the elements, (far exceeds) the gods in power; he is more vast than heaven and earth, or the widespread spacious firmament.

text.sanskrit: यं सोममिंद्र पृथिवीद्यावा गर्भं न माता बिभृतस्त्वाया ।तं ते हिन्वंति तमु ते मृजंत्यध्वर्यवो वृषभ पातवा उ ॥

translations.text: WhichSoma,Indra, the heaven and earth, containing for you, as a mother contains the embryo; showerer (of benefits), the priests pour it out for you they purify it for your drinking.

text.sanskrit: मरुत्वाँ इंद्र वृषभो रणाय पिबा सोममनुष्वधं मदाय ।आ सिंचस्व जठरे मध्व ऊर्मिं त्वं राजासि प्रदिवः सुतानां ॥
text.iast: marutvān  indra  vṛṣabhaḥ  raṇāya  píba  somam  anu-svadham  madāya ā  siñcasva  jaṭhare  madhvaḥ  ūrmím  tvam  rājā  asi  pra-dívaḥ  sutānām ||

translations.text: Indra, attended by theMaruts, the showerer (of benefits), drink theSomaoffered after the other presentations, for your exhilaration for battle; take into your belly the (full) wave of the inebriating (Soma), for you are lord of libations from the days of old.

text.sanskrit: सजोषा इंद्र सगणो मरुद्भिः सोमं पिब वृत्रहा शूर विद्वान् ।जहि शत्रूँरप मृधो नुदस्वाथाभयं कृणुहि विश्वतो नः ॥
text.iast: sa-joṣāḥ  indra  sa-gaṇaḥ  marut-bhiḥ  somam  piba  vṛtra-hā  śūra  vidvān jahí  śatrūn  apa  mṛdhaḥ  nudasva  atha  abhayam  kṛṇuhi  viśvataḥ  naḥ ||

translations.text: Indra, hero, rejoicing with and accompanied by the host ofMaruts, drink theSoma, for you are the slayer ofVṛtrathe sage; subdue our enemies, drive away the malevolent, make us safe on every side from peril.

text.sanskrit: सद्यो ह जातो वृषभः कनीनः प्रभर्तुमावदंधसः सुतस्य ।साधोः पिब प्रतिकामं यथा ते रसाशिरः प्रथमं सोम्यस्य ॥

text.sanskrit: यज्जायथास्तदहरस्य कामेऽंशोः पीयूषमपिबो गिरिष्ठां ।तं ते माता परि योषा जनित्री महः पितुर्दम आसिंचदग्रे ॥

text.sanskrit: यं नु नकिः पृतनासु स्वराजं द्विता तरति नृतमं हरिष्ठां ।इनतमः सत्वभिर्यो ह शूषैः पृथुज्रया अमिनादायुर्दस्योः ॥
text.iast: yam  nu  nakiḥ  pṛtanāsu  sva-rājam  dvitā  tarati  nṛ-tamam  hari-sthām ina-tamaḥ  satva-bhiḥ  yaḥ  ha  śūṣaiḥ  pṛthu-jrayāḥ  amināt  āyuḥ  dasyoḥ ||

translations.text: Whom, when borne by his steeds, foremost and eminent in battles, breaking in two the (hostile host), no one ever surpasses; supreme in a way, attended by his faithfulMaruts, and hastening to combat, he has destroyed with foe-withering (energies) the existence of theDasyu.

text.sanskrit: सहावा पृत्सु तरणिर्नार्वा व्यानशी रोदसी मेहनावान् ।भगो न कारे हव्यो मतीनां पितेव चारुः सुहवो वयोधाः ॥
text.iast: saha-vā  pṛt-su  taraṇiḥ  na  arvā  vi-ānaśíḥ  rodasī íti  mehanā-vān bhagaḥ  na  kāre  havyaḥ  matīnām  pitā-iva  cāruḥ  su-havaḥ  vayaḥ-dhāḥ ||

translations.text: Vigorous, rushing through (hostile hosts), like a war-horse, he has pervaded heaven and earth, sending down rain; he is to be worshipped with oblations at the solemn (rite) likeBhaga; he is as the father of those who adore (him); he is beautiful, worthy of invocation, the bestower of food.

text.sanskrit: धर्ता दिवो रजसस्पृष्ट ऊर्ध्वो रथो न वायुर्वसुभिर्नियुत्वान् ।क्षपां वस्ता जनिता सूर्यस्य विभक्ता भागं धिषणेव वाजं ॥
text.iast: dhartā  divaḥ  rajasaḥ  pṛṣṭaḥ  ūrdhvaḥ  rathaḥ  na  vāyuḥ  vasu-bhiḥ  niyutvān kṣapām  vastā  janitā  sūryasya  ví-bhaktā  bhāgam  dhiṣaṇā-iva  vājam ||

translations.text: The upholder of heaven and of the firmament, the wind, like a chariot traversing the upper (region) accompanied by theVasus; the clother of the night (with gloom), the parent of the sun, the distributor of the portion (allotted to the pious), like the words (of the wealthy appropriating to all) the food.

text.sanskrit: शुनं हुवेम मघवानमिंद्रमस्मिन्भरे नृतमं वाजसातौ ।शृण्वंतमुग्रमूतये समत्सु घ्नंतं वृत्राणि संजितं धनानां ॥

translations.text: We invoke for our protection the opulentIndra, distinguished in this combat, the leader in the food-bestowing (strife), hearing (our praises), terrible in battles, the destroyer of foes, the conqueror of wealth.

text.sanskrit: इंद्रः स्वाहा पिबतु यस्य सोम आगत्या तुम्रो वृषभो मरुत्वान् ।ओरुव्यचाः पृणतामेभिरन्नैरास्य हविस्तन्वः काममृध्याः ॥
text.iast: índraḥ  svāhā  pibatu  yasya  somaḥ  ā-gatya  tumraḥ  vṛṣabhaḥ  marutvān ā  uru-vyacāḥ  pṛṇatām  ebhíḥ  annaiḥ  ā  asya  havíḥ  tanvaḥ  kāmam  ṛdhyāḥ ||

translations.text: MayIndradrink the libation; he of whom is theSoma, having come to the sacrifice; he who is the repeller (of adversaries), the showerer (of benefits), the lord of theMaruts; may he, the wide-pervading, be plural ased with these (sacrificial) viands; may the oblation be adequate to the wants of his body.

text.sanskrit: आ ते सपर्यू जवसे युनज्मि ययोरनु प्रदिवः श्रुष्टिमावः ।इह त्वा धेयुर्हरयः सुशिप्र पिबा त्वस्य सुषुतस्य चारोः ॥
text.iast: ā  te  saparyū íti  javase  yunajmi  yayoḥ  anu  pra-dívaḥ  śruṣṭím  āvaḥ iha  tvā  dheyuḥ  harayaḥ  su-śipra  píba  tu  asya  su-sutasya  cāroḥ ||

translations.text: I yoke (to your car), to bring you quickly, your two docile horses, whose speed you have of old employed; may your horses, handsomeIndra, bring you hither, and drink promptly of this well-effused agreeable libation.

text.sanskrit: गोभिर्मिमिक्षुं दधिरे सुपारमिंद्रं ज्यैष्ठ्याय धायसे गृणानाः ।मंदानः सोमं पपिवाँ ऋजीषिन्त्समस्मभ्यं पुरुधा गा इषण्य ॥
text.iast: gobhiḥ  mimikṣum  dadhire  su-pāram  índram  jyaiṣṭhyāya  dhāyase  gṛṇānāḥ mandānaḥ  somam  papi-vān  ṛjīṣin  sam  asmabhyam  purudhā  gāḥ  iṣaṇya ||

translations.text: His adorers support with cattle,Indra, who is willing to bestow upon them their desires, and ready to come to the sacrifice, for the sake of obtaining eminent prosperity and prolonged life; acceptor of the spiritlessSoma, who are the drinker of the Soma, and are exhilarated (by the draught), grant to us freely cattle in abundance.

text.sanskrit: इमं कामं मंदया गोभिरश्वैश्चंद्रवता राधसा पप्रथश्च ।स्वर्यवो मतिभिस्तुभ्यं विप्रा इंद्राय वाहः कुशिकासो अक्रन् ॥

translations.text: Gratify this our desire (of wealth) with cows, with horses, with shining treasure, and make us renowned; the wiseKuśikas, desirous of heaven, offer praise of you,Indra, with pious (prayers).

text.sanskrit: शतक्रतुमर्णवं शाकिनं नरं गिरो म इंद्रमुप यंति विश्वतः ।वाजसनिं पूर्भिदं तूर्णिमप्तुरं धामसाचमभिषाचं स्वर्विदं ॥

text.sanskrit: आकरे वसोर्जरिता पनस्यतेऽनेहसः स्तुभ इंद्रो दुवस्यति ।विवस्वतः सदन आ हि पिप्रिये सत्रासाहमभिमातिहनं स्तुहि ॥

translations.text: Indra, the enfeebler (of adversaries), is praised as a mine of wealth; he is propitiated by righteous commendations; he is gratified in the dwelling of the offerer of oblations; glorify Indra, the conqueror, the destroyer of his enemies.

text.sanskrit: स्थिरौ गावौ भवतां वीळुरक्षो मेषा वि वर्हि मा युगं वि शारि ।इंद्रः पातल्ये ददतां शरीतोररिष्टनेमे अभि नः सचस्व ॥

translations.text: Give strength,Indra, to our bodies; give strength to our vehicles; (give) strength to our sons and grandsons; that they may live (long); for you are giver of strength.

text.sanskrit: इंद्रोतिभिर्बहुलाभिर्नो अद्य याच्छ्रेष्ठाभिर्मघवंछूर जिन्व ।यो नो द्वेष्ट्यधरः सस्पदीष्ट यमु द्विष्मस्तमु प्राणो जहातु ॥

translations.text: Indra, hero,possessor of wealth, protect us this day against our foes with many and excellent defences; may the vile wretch who hates us fall (before us); may the breath of life depart from him whom we hate.

text.sanskrit: परशुं चिद्वि तपति शिंबलं चिद्वि वृश्चति ।उखा चिदिंद्र येषंती प्रयस्ता फेनमस्यति ॥

translations.text: As (the tree) suffers pain from the axe, as the śimbal flower is (easily) cut off, as the injured cauldron leaking scatters foam, so may mine enemy perish.

text.sanskrit: न सायकस्य चिकिते जनासो लोधं नयंति पशु मन्यमानाः ।नावाजिनं वाजिना हासयंति न गर्दभं पुरो अश्वान्नयंति ॥

translations.text: Men, (the might) of the destroyer is not known toyou; regarding him as a mere animal, they lead him away desirous (silently to complete his devotions); the wise condescend not to turn the foolish into ridicule, they do not lead the ass before the horse.

text.sanskrit: इम इंद्र भरतस्य पुत्रा अपपित्वं चिकितुर्न प्रपित्वं ।हिन्वंत्यश्वमरणं न नित्यं ज्यावाजं परि णयंत्याजौ ॥

translations.text: These sons ofBharata,Indra, understand severance (from theVasiṣṭhas), not association (with them); they urge their steeds (against them) as against a constant foe; they bear a stout bow (for their destruction) in battle.

text.sanskrit: इमं महे विदथ्याय शूषं शश्वत्कृत्व ईड्याय प्र जभ्रुः ।शृणोतु नो दम्येभिरनीकैः शृणोत्वग्निर्दिव्यैरजस्रः ॥

translations.text: They recite repeatedly this gratifying praise to the great product of sacrifice (Agni); may he who is (endowed) with domestic radiance hear us; may the imperishable Agni, (endowed) with divine radiance, hear us.

text.sanskrit: महि महे दिवे अर्चा पृथिव्यै कामो म इच्छंचरति प्रजानन् ।ययोर्ह स्तोमे विदथेषु देवाः सपर्यवो मादयंते सचायोः ॥

translations.text: Knowing their greatness, offer worship to the vast heaven and to the earth; my desire, wishing (for felicity) proceed (to them), in whose praise the gods,desirous of adoration, delight together with their worshippers at the sacrifice.

text.sanskrit: युवोर्ऋतं रोदसी सत्यमस्तु महे षु णः सुविताय प्र भूतं ।इदं दिवे नमो अग्ने पृथिव्यै सपर्यामि प्रयसा यामि रत्नं ॥

translations.text: Heaven and earth, may your truth be ever inviolable; be propitious to us for the due completion of the rite; this adoration (Agni) is offered to heaven and earth; I worship (them) with (sacrificial) food; I solicit of them precious (wealth).

text.sanskrit: उतो हि वां पूर्व्या आविविद्र ऋतावरी रोदसी सत्यवाचः ।नरश्चिद्वां समिथे शूरसातौ ववंदिरे पृथिवि वेविदानाः ॥

translations.text: Heaven and earth, endowed with truth, they who are the ancient declarers of the truth, have obtained from you (what they desired); and so, earth, men cognizant (of the greaness of you both) have worshipped you for the sake of triumphing over (hostile) heroes in battle.

text.sanskrit: कविर्नृचक्षा अभि षीमचष्ट ऋतस्य योना विघृते मदंती ।नाना चक्राते सदनं यथा वेः समानेन क्रतुना संविदाने ॥

text.sanskrit: इंद्रो विश्वैर्वीर्यैः पत्यमान उभे आ पप्रौ रोदसी महित्वा ।पुरंदरो वृत्रहा धृष्णुषेणः संगृभ्या न आ भरा भूरि पश्वः ॥
text.iast: índraḥ  víśvaiḥ  vīryaiḥ  patyamānaḥ  ubhe íti  ā  paprau  rodasī íti  mahi-tvā puram-daraḥ  vṛtra-hā  dhṛṣṇu-seṇaḥ  sam-gṛbhya  naḥ  ā  bhara  bhūri  paśvaḥ ||

translations.text: Indra, invested with all energies, has filled both heaven and earth with his greatness; do you, who are the destroyer of cities, the slayer ofVṛtra, the leader of a conquering host, collect cattle and bestow them abundantly upon us.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: नासत्या मे पितरा बंधुपृच्छा सजात्यमश्विनोश्चारु नाम ।युवं हि स्थो रयिदौ नो रयीणां दात्रं रक्षेथे अकवैरदब्धा ॥
text.iast: nāsatyā  me  pitarā  bandhu-pṛcchā  sa-jātyam  aśvínoḥ  cāru  nāma yuvam  hí  sthaḥ  rayi-dau  naḥ  rayīṇām  dātram  rakṣethe íti  akavaiḥ  adabdhā ||

translations.text: Nāsatyas, my protectors, inquirers (after the wishes) of your kinsman, beautiful is your cognate appellation ofAśvins; be to us the liberal donors of riches; do you, who are irresistible, protect the offerer (of the oblation) with unblameable (defences).]

text.sanskrit: महत्तद्वः कवयश्चारु नाम यद्ध देवा भवथ विश्व इंद्रे ।सख ऋभुभिः पुरुहूत प्रियेभिरिमां धियं सातये तक्षता नः ॥
text.iast: mahat  tat  vaḥ  kavayaḥ  cāru  nāma  yat  ha  devāḥ  bhavatha  víśve  índre sakhā  ṛbhu-bhiḥ  puru-hūta  priyebhiḥ  imām  dhíyam  sātaye  takṣata  naḥ ||

translations.text: Sages acquainted with the past, excellent is that beautiful appellation under which you have both become gods in (the sphere of)Indra; do you, Indra, the invoked of many, a friend, (associated) with the belovedṛbhus, shape this prayer for our benefit.

text.sanskrit: अर्यमा णो अदितिर्यज्ञियासोऽदब्धानि वरुणस्य व्रतानि ।युयोत नो अनपत्यानि गंतोः प्रजावान्नः पशुमाँ अस्तु गातुः ॥

translations.text: MayAryaman,Aditi, the adorable (gods), and the unimpeded functions ofVaruṇa(protect) us; keep us from (following) the course unpropitious to offspring, and may our dwelling be abundant in progeny and cattle.

text.sanskrit: शृण्वंतु नो वृषणः पर्वतासो ध्रुवक्षेमास इळया मदंतः ।आदित्यैर्नो अदितिः शृणोतु यच्छंतु नो मरुतः शर्म भद्रं ॥

text.sanskrit: सदा सुगः पितुमाँ अस्तु पंथा मध्वा देवा ओषधीः सं पिपृक्त ।भगो मे अग्ने सख्ये न मृध्या उद्रायो अश्यां सदनं पुरुक्षोः ॥
text.iast: sadā  su-gaḥ  pitu-mān  astu  panthāḥ  madhvā  devāḥ  oṣadhīḥ  sam  pipṛkta bhagaḥ  me  agne  sakhye  na  mṛdhyāḥ  ut  rāyaḥ  aśyām  sadanam  puru-kṣoḥ ||

translations.text: May our path ever be easy of going, and provided with food; sprinkle, gods, the plural nts with sweet water; (safe) in your friendship,Agni, may my fortune never be impaired, but may I occupy a dwelling (abounding) with riches and ample food.

text.sanskrit: स्वदस्व हव्या समिषो दिदीह्यस्मद्र्यक्सं मिमीहि श्रवांसि ।विश्वाँ अग्ने पृत्सु तांजेषि शत्रूनहा विश्वा सुमना दीदिही नः ॥
text.iast: svadasva  havyā  sam  íṣaḥ  didīhi  asmadryak  sam  mimīhi  śravāṃsi víśvān  agne  pṛt-su  tān  jeṣi  śatrūn  ahā  víśvā  su-manāḥ  dīdihi  naḥ ||

translations.text: Taste (Agni) the oblations, make manifest (for us) abundant food measure out the viands before us; you overcome all those (who are) our enemies in conflict;  favourably inclined towards us lighten up all our (ceremonies) day by day.

text.sanskrit: उषसः पूर्वा अध यद्व्यूषुर्महद्वि जज्ञे अक्षरं पदे गोः ।व्रता देवानामुप नु प्रभूषन्महद्देवानामसुरत्वमेकं ॥
text.iast: uṣasaḥ  pūrvāḥ  adha  yat  vi-ūṣuḥ  mahat  ví  jajñe  akṣaram  pade  goḥ vratā  devānām  upa  nu  pra-bhūṣan  mahat  devānām  asura-tvam  ekam ||

translations.text: When the preceding dawns appear, the great imperishable (light) is engendered in the (firmament, the) sphere of the waters, and then the worshipper is alert to perform the rites (due to) the gods, for great and unequalled is the might of the gods.

text.sanskrit: मो षू णो अत्र जुहुरंत देवा मा पूर्वे अग्ने पितरः पदज्ञाः ।पुराण्योः सद्मनोः केतुरंतर्महद्देवानामसुरत्वमेकं ॥
text.iast: mo íti  su  naḥ  atra  juhuranta  devāḥ  mā  pūrve  agne  pitaraḥ  pada-jñāḥ purāṇyoḥ  sadmanoḥ  ketuḥ  antaḥ  mahat  devānām  asura-tvam  ekam ||

translations.text: Let not the gods,Agni, now do us harm, nor the ancient progenitors, who have come to know the degree (of divinity); nor the manifester of light between the two ancient dwellings (earth and heaven, the sun); for great and unequalled is the might of the gods.

text.sanskrit: वि मे पुरुत्रा पतयंति कामाः शम्यच्छा दीद्ये पूर्व्याणि ।समिद्धे अग्नावृतमिद्वदेम महद्देवानामसुरत्वमेकं ॥

translations.text: Variously do my manifold desires alight; present at the solemnity,  I recite ancient (hymns); when the fire is kindled we speak indeed the truth, for great and unequalled is the might of the gods.

text.sanskrit: समानो राजा विभृतः पुरुत्रा शये शयासु प्रयुतो वनानु ।अन्या वत्सं भरति क्षेति माता महद्देवानामसुरत्वमेकं ॥
text.iast: samānaḥ  rājā  ví-bhṛtaḥ  puru-trā  śaye  śayāsu  pra-yutaḥ  vanā  anu anyā  vatsam  bharati  kṣeti  mātā  mahat  devānām  asura-tvam  ekam ||

translations.text: The universal sovereign is conveyed to many directions; he sleeps in the plural ces of repose; he is connected with the forests; one mother (heaven) nourishes the child; the other (earth) gives him a dwelling; great and unequalled is the might of the gods.

text.sanskrit: शयुः परस्तादध नु द्विमाताबंधनश्चरति वत्स एकः ।मित्रस्य ता वरुणस्य व्रतानि महद्देवानामसुरत्वमेकं ॥

translations.text: The child of two mothers sleeps in the west, but (in the morning) the single infant proceeds unobstructed (through the sky); these are the functions ofMitraandVaruṇa; great and unequalled is the might of the gods.

text.sanskrit: पद्या वस्ते पुरुरूपा वपूंष्यूर्ध्वा तस्थौ त्र्यविं रेरिहाणा ।ऋतस्य सद्म वि चरामि विद्वान्महद्देवानामसुरत्वमेकं ॥

translations.text: The earth wears bodies of many forms; she abides on high cherishing her year and a half old (calf); knowing the abode of the truth (the sun), I offer worship; great and unequalled is the might of the gods.

text.sanskrit: या ते जिह्वा मधुमती सुमेधा अग्ने देवेषूच्यत उरूची ।तयेह विश्वाँ अवसे यजत्राना सादय पायया चा मधूनि ॥

translations.text: With your wide-spreading tongue,Agni, sweet and intelligent, which is renowned amongst the gods, bring hither all the adorable deities for our protection, and give them to drink of the sweet (libations).
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: या ते अग्ने पर्वतस्येव धारासश्चंती पीपयद्देव चित्रा ।तामस्मभ्यं प्रमतिं जातवेदो वसो रास्व सुमतिं विश्वजन्यां ॥
text.iast: yā  te  agne  parvatasya-iva  dhārā  asaścantī  pīpayat  deva  citrā tām  asmabhyam  pra-matim  jāta-vedaḥ  vaso íti  rāsva  su-matím  viśva-janyām ||

translations.text: DivineAgni, giver of dwellings, knower of all that exists, extend to us that benevolence which, unshared by others, cherishes us like the showers of the rain-cloud; that kindness which is beneficent for all mankind.

text.sanskrit: धेनुः प्रत्नस्य काम्यं दुहानांतः पुत्रश्चरति दक्षिणायाः ।आ द्योतनिं वहति शुभ्रयामोषसः स्तोमो अश्विनावजीगः ॥

translations.text: The cow (the dawn) yields the desired milk to the ancient (Agni); the son of the south passes within (the firmament); the bright-houred (day) brings the illuminative (sun); the praiser awakes (to glorify) theAśvinspreceding the dawn.

text.sanskrit: सुयुग्वहंति प्रति वामृतेनोर्ध्वा भवंति पितरेव मेधाः ।जरेथामस्मद्वि पणेर्मनीषां युवोरवश्चकृमा यातमर्वाक् ॥

translations.text: The well-yoked (horses) bear you both in your truth (preserving car); the offerings proceed towards you as (children to their parents); discard from us the disposition of the niggard; we have made ready for you our offering; come to our presence.

translations.text: Your ancient friendship is desirable and auspicious; your wealth, leaders (of rites), is in the family ofJahnu; renewing that auspicious friendship, may we, your associates, delight you with the sweet (Soma).
